sections.title: Custom Property Drawers
sections.html:
?

Define your own PropertyAttribute + PropertyDrawer to create custom Inspector widgets:

// 1) Create the attribute
public class MyRange : PropertyAttribute
{
    public float min, max;
    public MyRange(float min, float max)
    {
        this.min = min;
        this.max = max;
    }
}

// 2) Create the drawer
#if UNITY_EDITOR
[CustomPropertyDrawer(typeof(MyRange))]
public class MyRangeDrawer : PropertyDrawer
{
    public override void OnGUI(Rect position, SerializedProperty property, GUIContent label)
    {
        var range = (MyRange)attribute;
        property.floatValue = EditorGUI.Slider(
            position,
            label,
            property.floatValue,
            range.min,
            range.max
        );
    }
}
#endif

// 3) Use it
public class Example : MonoBehaviour
{
    [MyRange(0f, 1f)]
    public float blend;
}

sections.title: ReSharper Formatter Directives
sections.html:
?

Tell ReSharper (Rider / VS + ReSharper) to skip formatting between markers:

// @formatter:off
var  weirdlyFormatted   =   "leave   me    alone!";
// @formatter:on

Note: In Visual Studio, enable Enable formatter markers under ReSharper → Options → Code Editing → C# → Formatting Style → General.

Does not work in CSS.

sections.title: Visual Studio
sections.html:
?

VS does not support formatter-off comments natively. Use #region to mark areas:

#region DoNotFormat
var  tempHack  =   "manually     preserved";
// Add comments or notes here
#endregion
